page.title: 02NEWSPAPER STORIES (5.7.85)
page.content: We looked at the front page of two local newspapers to find out what the main stories for the{fifth of {July,1985,}were. Looking at both papers, neither paper had chosen to report the same story on the front page. One newspaper had a lengthy report about{parking}fees in{Waltham Cross. It had been hoped that parking fees for the local multy-storey car park would be abandoned, in order to encourage more people to shop in the area. But at a recent council meeting it had been out-voted (15 votes to 13). The other paper carried six shorter stories. The main one was about the {West Essex Health Authorities}plan to close{Honey Lane Hospital.}This is a hospital which at present serves the people of Waltham Abbey.
